context.p: Use the euca-create-tags command to add a tag to a resource.

step.cmd: Enter the following command and parameters:
step.stepresult: Eucalyptus returns a the resource identifier and its tag key and value.

example.p: The following example shows how to add a tag to an EMI. This tag key is dataserver and has no value.
example.codeblock: euca-create-tags emi-1a2b3c4d --tag dataserver TAG emi-1a2b3c4d image dataserver
example.p: The following example shows how to add the same two tags to both an EMI and an instance. One tag key is dataserver, which has no value, an empty string. The other tag key is stack, which has a value of Production.
example.codeblock: euca-create-tags emi-1a2b3c4d i-6f5d4e3a --tag dataserver --tag stack=Production TAG emi-1a2b3c4d image dataserver TAG emi-1a2b3c4d image stack Production TAG i-6f5d4e3a image dataserver TAG i-6f5d4e3a image stack Production
